dashboard.control

Class MouseWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • acm.graphics.GCompound
        • dashboard.control.MouseWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    acm.graphics.GContainer, acm.graphics.GScalable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Button, ButtonGrid, Group

    public abstract class MouseWidget
extends acm.graphics.GCompound
    Provides the base functionality for all user-interactable widgets that require mouse input.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface acm.graphics.GContainer

        BACK_TO_FRONT, FRONT_TO_BACK

      Gets the name of the MouseWidget that will be displayed in subsequent call hierarchies.
      java.lang.String mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called by the client to simulate the mouse being clicked, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.
      java.lang.String mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called by the client to simulate the mouse being dragged, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.
      java.lang.String mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called by the client to simulate the mouse entering the window, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.
      java.lang.String mouseExited(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called by the client to simulate the mouse exiting the window, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.
      java.lang.String mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called by the client to simulate the mouse being moved, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.
      java.lang.String mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called by the client to simulate the mouse being pressed, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.
      java.lang.String mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called by the client to simulate the mouse being released, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.

    • Constructor Detail

        public MouseWidget()

    • Method Detail

      • mousePressed

        public java.lang.String mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Called by the client to simulate the mouse being pressed, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.

        This method serves as a wrapper for onMousePressed, which is overridden by subclasses of MouseWidget as an action callback.

        Parameters:
        e - a MouseEvent that represents the associated mouse action
        Returns:
        the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy

      • mouseReleased

        public java.lang.String mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Called by the client to simulate the mouse being released, and returns a string representing the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy.

        This method serves as a wrapper for onMouseReleased, which is overridden by subclasses of MouseWidget as an action callback.

        Parameters:
        e - a MouseEvent that represents the associated mouse action
        Returns:
        the end action being executed and the associated call hierarchy

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the MouseWidget that will be displayed in subsequent call hierarchies.
        Parameters:
        name - a label for the MouseWidget

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the MouseWidget that will be displayed in subsequent call hierarchies.
        Returns:
        the name of the MouseWidget

      • onMousePressed

        public void onMousePressed(acm.graphics.GObject o)
        Called by mousePressed to execute code specific to this MouseWidget. The client should override this function to implement a callback for the specific MouseWidget. As the method exists within a wrapper function, the client should not explicitly call subwidgets' versions of mousePressed.
        Parameters:
        o - the exact element within the MouseWidget that the client interacted with

      • onMouseReleased

        public void onMouseReleased(acm.graphics.GObject o)
        Called by mouseReleased to execute code specific to this MouseWidget. The client should override this function to implement a callback for the specific MouseWidget. As the method exists within a wrapper function, the client should not explicitly call subwidgets' versions of mouseReleased.
        Parameters:
        o - the exact element within the MouseWidget that the client interacted with
